citation.article-title: Pontibaca methylaminivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the family Rhodobacteraceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Pontibaca [Pon.ti.ba′ca. L. n. pontus the sea; L. fem. n. baca a berry, especially an olive; N.L. fem. n. Pontibaca olive-shaped (bacterium) of the sea].
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, facultatively anaerobic, oval-shaped rods.
Major polar lipids are phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylglycerol.
Major fatty acids are 16 : 0, 18 : 1ω7c and 19 : 0 cyclo ω8c (together representing 83 % of the total in the type strain of the type species).
The predominant respiratory quinone is ubiquinone Q-10.
The type species is Pontibaca methylaminivorans.
